During the [*8th Biennial International Conference on the Linguistics of Contemporary English* (8 BICLCE)](https://www.uni-bamberg.de/en/eng-ling/biclce-2019/) held at the Otto-Friedrich-Universität Bamberg, Germany (26-28 September), I was awarded the prize to the Best Paper presented at the conference by a junior researcher. The paper, entitled *Negation and the Cognitive Complexity Principle in the English Clausal Complementation System* is part of my PhD project, supervised by Elena Seoane and Manfred Krug.
